result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Peter Terpstra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary Peter Terpstra

records.addlTxt: 9:49 AM Defendant Zachary Peter Terpstra in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter R. Moyers in court for Zachary Peter Terpstra.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1. Count 2 is dismissed and read in. Court orders 3 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System comprised of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 2 years of extended supervision concurrent with any other sentence. Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program. Costs DOC collect. Sentence credit 127 days.
